description._content: ID: 068507 Title: Travels through Virginia. From Theodor de Bry's 'America', Vol. I, 1590, after a drawing of John White Image taken from Travels through Virginia. Author: "Strachey, William (William Strachey)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Illustrator: "White, John; Bry, Theodor de (John White; Theodor de Bry)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Provenance: England; 1618 Caption: 'The beauty of the earthenware vessels in which they cook food'. Engraving of a large cylindrical earthenware pot, with conical base, which rests on a wood fire. The pot contains a liquid mixture, with fish, ears of maize, and probably small fruit. Two Native Indians tend the fire; one holding a wooden spoon, and the other kneeling figure fanning the flames. Language: English Source identifier: Sloane 1622, f.84 British Library Shelfmark: Sloane 1622 If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of this image, please place an order at Images Online imagesonline.bl.uk. The details from the above list should help you locate the images.
